fields.request: Manual QA: Confirm auto-upgrade service points to deployment directory
fields.request_details:
1. On a node with systemd-managed auto-upgrade (e.g., service name from `cat locks/service.lck`), ensure `${SERVICE}-auto-upgrade.service` exists under the systemd directory.
2. Run `./upgrade.sh` from the deployment root to apply the service migration.
3. Open `${SYSTEMD_DIR:-/etc/systemd/system}/${SERVICE}-auto-upgrade.service` and confirm the WorkingDirectory now matches the deployment root path.
4. Restart the unit with `sudo systemctl restart ${SERVICE}-auto-upgrade` and verify `systemctl status` reports it active without CHDIR errors in the journal.
